session_summary: Andrew and Audrey caught up at 5:53 pm on 24 September, 2023. Audrey shared a recent incident where her dog's leash broke, causing a scare but strengthening their bond. She advised patience and regular training to build trust with dogs. They discussed training tricks, going for walks, and Audrey's mutt breeds. Andrew admired Audrey's garden with Peruvian Lilies, easy to care for and enjoyed by her dogs. They shared the joy their furry pals bring into their lives, highlighting the strong bond and happiness they provide.

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: Hey Audrey! Long time no talk! How have you been?

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photography of a red retractable leash with a black handle
conversation_turns.text: Hey! I'm alright. Had some bumps though - last Friday at the park one of my pups saw something and pulled so hard the leash busted. Scared that she might run off and get hurt, so I had to chase after her. Luckily I caught her before anything bad happened. Little moments like this remind me how important she is and how we should be careful when we're out there.

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: Oh man, sorry to hear that! I'm totally getting anxious just thinking about my dog getting lost. Precious must have been really scared. What did you do to calm her down?

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a dog laying on a bed with its head on the pillow
conversation_turns.query: dog lying on soft bed peaceful
conversation_turns.text: I petted and hugged her, spoke calmly, and slowly walked her to relax. Our bond feels even stronger when moments like these show up.

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photography of a dog running in a field with a frisbee
conversation_turns.text: She looks so adorable! That's the connection I'd like to have with Toby. Any advice on creating a strong relationship with dogs?

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photography of three dogs wearing birthday hats and sitting next to each other
conversation_turns.text: Building trust with them needs patience and regular training. Give them time and love, and praise their successes.

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a dog sitting on a sidewalk in a garden
conversation_turns.text: Thanks for the tips! Patience and practice are important for establishing a bond with our pooches, just like any other meaningful relationship. I guess some dogs just need more time! It must be so satisfying to see those successes and progress. Oh, and your pup looks so sharp in that green hat! Is there anything specific you do with them to work on training?

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a group of dogs sitting on a chair
conversation_turns.text: Thanks! We work on obedience and teach them tricks like sit, stay, shake, and roll over. It's fun and rewarding for both of us.

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: Wow, teaching them tricks must be super fun! How often do you take them for walks?

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of two dogs sitting next to each other on a beach
conversation_turns.text: Very often, multiple times a day even, it's a great exercise for them and great bonding time for us.

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: Hmm that does sound like a great way to bond! What breeds are they again? Their breeds might make a difference regarding how well they bond too.

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photography of a group of dogs tied to a leash on a brick walkway
conversation_turns.query: mixed breed dogs sitting blanket park
conversation_turns.text: They're all mutts. Two of them are Jack Russell mixes and the other two are Chihuahua mixes. And yea, I believe so! Some dog breeds do bond better than others.

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: Aww, they're all so cute! So much fluff and joy!

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photography of three small dogs sitting on a couch with a white fur
conversation_turns.text: I love them for that. They really do bring so much joy into my life.

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a balcony with a bunch of flowers on it
conversation_turns.query: balcony garden blooming flowers vegetable patch
conversation_turns.text: Yeah! They really do bring so much into our lives - it's amazing to watch them interact. Here's something I've been taking care of lately. Look at those flowers!

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.text: Nice! Taking care of something like this relaxes me and brings me peace too. I personally have a small garden as well ya know.

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: That's cool! How's it going?

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a cactus plant with two white flowers
conversation_turns.text: It's going great! The flowers are looking great and my veggie patch is coming along. It's so fun to see them grow! Really feels accomplishing.

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: Those flowers look great! What kind are they?

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.text: They're called Peruvian Lilies. They are so awesome - they have such bright colors and delicate petals.

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: They're beautiful! So vibrant and eye-catching. Are they difficult to care for?

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photography of a dog laying on a wooden dock in a pond
conversation_turns.text: Nope, they're easy to take care of, perfect for me! Just gotta water them and make sure they get enough sun.

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: Awesome! Do they enjoy playing in the garden too?

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photography of two dogs running in a grassy field
conversation_turns.text: Yeah, they do enjoy the garden! Always running around, exploring and having a great time. So adorable!

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: Wow! Looks like they're having a blast. Are there any other furry pals they play with, or just the ones you have?

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photography of a dog and a teddy bear sleeping on a couch
conversation_turns.text: Just my fur babies.

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: Must be great having them around, the bond between you and them is awesome.

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photography of three dogs sitting on a couch with a laptop in the background
conversation_turns.query: cute dogs cuddling on the couch
conversation_turns.text: Yeah, they do! They make everything so much better. Can't imagine life without them. They mean everything to me.

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: That's such a lovely picture, Audrey! So cute to see them snuggled up, having fun together. They really bring so much joy to our lives.

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.text: They really do, bringing loads of love and happiness. They are everything to me.

Audrey: Precious pulls at her leash and gets lost during a walk in the park, but Audrey chases her and finds her.
Audrey's flower and vegetable garden patch comes along.
Andrew: Andrew and his girlfriend try their hand at gardening, growing some flowers of their own.
Andrew expressed concern and empathy for Audrey's dog when she got scared and ran off at the park.
Andrew is interested in building a strong relationship with dogs and seeks advice on the matter.
Andrew believes patience and regular training are essential in building a strong relationship with dogs.
Andrew finds joy in taking care of flowers and enjoys watching them grow in his garden.
Audrey: Audrey experienced a moment of worry when her dog's leash broke at the park, and she had to chase after her.
Audrey finds strengthening the bond with her dogs through petting, hugs, and calmness during stressful situations.
Audrey emphasizes the importance of patience, love, and regular training in building trust and a strong relationship with dogs.
Audrey teaches her dogs obedience and tricks like sit, stay, shake, and roll over for fun and reward.
Audrey's dogs are mutts; two are Jack Russell mixes, and two are Chihuahua mixes.
Audrey has a small garden where she takes care of Peruvian Lilies, finding peace and relaxation in gardening.
Audrey's Peruvian Lilies are easy to care for, requiring watering and enough sunlight.
Audrey's Peruvian Lilies enjoy the garden, running around, exploring, and having fun.
Audrey's furry companions mean everything to her and bring loads of love and happiness into her life.
